inn1.comm: Bell takes a step down the pitch, arrogantly so, and strokes him through the covers. There's some gumption
a better line from Bracken this time on middle stump and fuller, drawing Bell forward. He does come forward, and defends
and again it's defended on the front foot by Bell
good, nagging line from Bracken here, just short of a length and wide enough for Bell to leave - but there's a touch of shape back into the right hander here
cut off the back foot, with pleasing timing, straight down into the ground and straight to Clarke at point
excellent line and length with which to finish the over, Bell defending it with nervous-like energy, prodding it down and skipping down the pitch - threatening to run. But he doesn't
ooh quick! Zippy, nasty delivery first up for Vaughan, this one rising on him. He shouldered arms, but the ball followed him - as though magnetised to his neck - and it flew through to Gilchrist
but Vaughan's off the mark here, as Tait sends down one a touch fuller which Vaughan, although on the back foot, angles it down past gully and screams Bell through for a single
well bowled again, 91 mph (146kph), rising on Bell who, like Vaughan, leaves alone. The ball died on Gilchrist there
clunked into the covers on the front foot
really testing line from Tait here, just outside off stump and Vaughan watches it sail by - though is watchful of where his off stump is
yorker-length but off target, just wide enough of Vaughan's off stump and he clamps down on it
too wide and it's easily left alone
Bell advances again, almost making it into a half volley, but Bell doesn't make anything of it, just punching it feebly into the covers
nicely, elegantly cut off the back foot. I like to call that a Test cut. England need some one-day savagery in the first 15 overs
ooh edged! Close! Vaughan takes a Bell-like step down the pitch, and gets a thick outside edge. Some might say he angled it on purpose. I, on the other hand, think he didn't
but it's a bit too wide and left alone this time
excellent end to the over, cutting this back into Vaughan who is watchful in defence
a Tait slingshot down the leg side - almost Malinga-like there - and it wibbles off Bell's pad down to fine leg
gone! Again short from Tait, Vaughan went back and simply played it onto his stumps.
another bouncer - and, rejoice, it's wided by the umpire.
on leg stump, short of a length, and Strauss punches it off his hip
oh yes, lovely shot from Strauss just driving it crisply through extra cover. It beats Hodge who sets off in pursuit and hauls it down

big, big shout from Tait who does a war dance in front of the umpire. Billy Bowden is utterly unimpressed, by both the appeal and the dance - that was miles, miles down the leg side and Bowden shakes his head
on off stump, Bell is forward in defence
firmly forward, Strauss blocks this out to cover
good movement from Strauss, confidently forward again and driving this with a crisp flourish - but he can't time it and it bobbles out into the off side
Strauss isn't tempted by a wide one - I would've been - and leaves it well alone
neatly struck, looking to drive it straight but he opens the face of his bat at the last moment, cracking it behind square
full, straight, defended. Nothing more, nothing less
edged, but it falls short of where second slip wasn't. And down to third man it flies - but Tait does fantastically well down there, diving to his right to prevent four
crashed back past the bowler for four. Fabulous shot really, just leaning on it and timing it quite beautifully
Bell is back and across, defending this with a high left elbow
too short and wide - left alone by Bell but, well, it's another dot ball
my word, I thought he'd bowled him there. The noise of a thick-inside edge can often sound similar to the "death rattle." Yorker length and Bell just clamped down on it in time
on leg stump, again quick - the perfect delivery to the right-hander, actually - but it rams into Strauss's pads and he can't make anything of it
the first genuinely filthy wide from Tait and Gilchrist, well - he does brilliantly to save four (or rather, five), diving to his right
gone! A mirror of Vaughan's dismissal; short of a length, Strauss back onto his stumps, he tried to cut it but with a rather ugly cross-bat and it's dragged on
again Bell advances down the pitch with impressive intent, but can't actually make anything of the ball. It bobbles out onto the leg side with meek intent
defended out into the covers. No charge from Bell
full, just on off stump, Bell charges and strokes him to mid-off. But straight to mid-off and again there's no run
angled down just past Hayden at first slip - who does brilliantly, leaping to his right like the salmon he is not
it's full, it's straight, it's defended on the back foot
terrific bowling this from Bracken, it really is. And with Gilchrist up to the stumps, Bell is trapped - he just can't get it away. Pushed back to the bowler

on off stump, firmly cracked back to Tait who fields in his follow-through, the momentum - and his own fleet-footedness - carries him within a metre or so of Pietersen, staring him down. Pietersen stares him back
on leg stump this time and Pietersen turns it to square leg
what a fabulous shot. That is quite brilliant, just punching it straight back past Tait. An on-drive of fierce power
and Pietersen goes for an expansive crash through the covers but misses out, clunking it straight to cover
and again he crashes, but gets a thick inside edge into his boot
Tait rather loses his line here, Pietersen just clipping him off his hip
defended on the back foot
"ooh nice Bracko" cries Gilchrist as Bell defends this off the back foot
just short of a length but Bell can't break cover
cracked on the front foot to cover. But straight to cover
down the leg side, Gilchrist takes it brilliantly but can't save Rudi calling it a wide
Bell has absolutely hammered this, square, but straight to Ponting at what can only be described as a very short point. Superbly fielded
guided off the back foot past the short Ponting at short point
a bit of a heave there from Bracken. Bless him, he's getting tired. Pietersen nudges it off his hip
Bell runs down the pitch at a 100 mph and cracks him over midwicket - a short, slow delivery which Bell spoons over midwicket
Bell defends on the back foot
shot. Not quite as well timed as he'd like, but he lofts it neatly over mid-off
neatly back-cut past point - in fact, in front of point, in front of square
McGrath-line-and-length, on off stump and it's defended with fierce caution
nudged off his hip to end the over
tidy start for Clarke, round the wicket to the righthander, and Pietersen has to defend that one
groaned up there again, on the spot, and again Pietersen can only defend
a touch shorter this time and that's patient from the big man, who strides into the ball and times a soft-handed drive to mid-off
touch of bounce here and that's just defended down on the back foot, without too much fuss
drags it short and there's a premeditated sweep, on one knee, round to fine leg
another sweep, this one in front of square, and there's a fine piece of sweeping from the sweeper/boundary rider* (*delete according to preference)
on the spot outside off and that's defended forward
drags it a touch short and Bell opens up his arms, ready to drive through covers, doesn't get hold of it quite right and an edge crashes forward into the ground
this one's a quiet defence
a touch of room outside off again and Bell waits to play a just-a-shade-late cut through gully and the pair set off immediately
Pietersen comes down the track and McGrath can't adjust in time, Pietersen whipping that strongly off his legs in front of midwicket

bouncer, of course, and Pietersen stands tall as he can - which is pretty tall - to pull that off one leg to midwicket. Oh, he didn't get hold of it, but he did wrap his tongue around a few words and McGrath's giving it back.
driven softly off the back foot back to mid-off
outside off and Pietersen lets that one carry through to Gilchrist
on a good length, Pietersen can't get any power on that and "Oh yes!" that's pleased Gilchrist
another one skids through to the keeper just outside the off stump
turns right back in from outside off and Pietersen's stride probably saves him
defended this time
McGrath nearly gets Bell there, Bell opening the face and just failing to get a tickle on the way through to Gilchrist. Bell has to lean on his bat, like a crutch for an old man, to compose himself
hits through the line and that's a really decent shot from Bell, lifting that over cover
two fours on the bounce - outside off again and that's a really great square drive, perfect timing, the sort of shot that when you nail it you know has gone the second you connect
on a better line and length, Bell takes the power of it, working to covers, but he's still looking hungry every ball
ah, hello, another sweet drive from Bell, this time he decides to lean into the ball and drive it wide of mid-off - a rocket
more width outside off and Bell growls as he fails to give it the treatment through point, instead lashing it into the ground
Pietersen is indeed getting impatient - going to sweep that, and missing
he connects on the sweep this time, that one in front of square
and another sweep
this time Pietersen takes his usual two strides down and plays that one one-legged, on the front foot, and that's driven literally on the front foot through long-on
that's big! Short ball which Pietersen scoops that off the bottom of the bat and sends it high and travelling
short again, this one outside off and Pietersen cheekily takes it from outside the sticks and sweeps it right over in front of square
over the wicket, spears that one in outside leg, it turns back in and Pietersen swishes it back out off the back foot
outside the line again, Pietersen on one knee and that's an easy sweep in front of square
another sweep, finds the gap this time and they get the single
right up there, straight, and there's a loud, but solo, shout from the bowler as the batsman defends
driven out to mid-off this time, but straight to the man there
up there and there's a sweep in front of square. They think about coming back for two and decide against it
stepped down and swept that one from outside off round in front of square, really using the angles well
quicker ball, but the batsman is up to the task, working it away to point
width on that one, but Pietersen doesn't make the most, slamming it into the ground on the off side, not timing it at all
got hold of it this time with a well-struck pull and Mr Hussey on the boundary can't cut it off despite his Superman-like dive
swept round really fine and there's an immediate call for two, the batsmen getting back comfortably
sweep shot, just for the single this time - it's easily picked up
right up there, tidy delivery and that's worked to short midwicket
bit of loop on that one, not connected with properly, Pietersen struggling to get over it as much as anything, and that's driven back forward
swept past Tait
on one knee but doesn't get properly engaged, that one just dribbling out to square
full toss, but again it's at an awkward height; still, he manages to driven it out to long-on
worked away off the toes to midwicket
straight and that's driven out to long-on
on the money, pitching on off, and Bell can only defend that one on his back foot
strays on to leg and there's a quick single, Ponting have a shy at the stumps as Bell just drops that one into the short midwicket region; good tip-and-run fare
cheeky sweep, on one knee and sending it aerial, but safe, and taking on Hogg's arm with the second; the batsmen win
Pietersen doesn't get hold of that one which comes in at him on the off, fuller than he was expecting, and he defends
this time Pietersen backed away showing all three sticks even before the ball had been bowled, and he smashes that one through the gap between mid-off and cover and it fair races away
straight and that's paddled away square to bring up England's 100 in the 20th over
a play and a miss this time, the ball pitching outside off and just going straight on, nearly taking the edge
comes forward to drive that straight, but gets a leading edge which goes in the gap in front of mid-off - a desperate cry of "Catch it" goes unanswered
driven to mid-on this time
worked into the covers this time
comes down the track, is forced to defend, and simultaneous "Aaaw"s ring out - I think the Aussies like that one, mate
drifting down leg and worked further to leg
pushed back to Symonds and his massive hair
too short, pulled by Bell but Hodge does well out on the deep square leg boundary, saving four
delicately clipped through midwicket, aerially, for two
too straight from Symonds but Bell can't pierce the gap at cover, just nudging it off his hip
very neatly defended on the back foot, timing it well enough to earn him a single
the wrong line from Hogg, outside his leg stump and Bell just turns it to leg
again wide of the leg stump, Pietersen sweeps - almost too full to be sweeping, but he gets it on the full and turns it behind square
quietly turned on the front foot through midwicket
once again, an Ashley-Giles-esque line on leg stump and it's clipped for a single to leg
lovely shot, back-cutting with deftness, just using the pace of the ball to guide the ball down to third man
milked to cover for another single
drifts this onto his leg stump who turns it past square leg for his fifty
pushed back to Symonds. To his right
short of a length, Bell turns it off his hip and there's his fifty - his tenth in ODIs

dropped! Pietersen has been dropped, by Ponting at mid-on - but it was a terrific effort. A blinding attempt, diving to his right but he just couldn't hold on. It was a slower ball which came out as a full toss, Pietersen tried to whip it over midwicket but got a slight leading edge to Ponting at mid-on. What an effort. Hopefully we'll have a photo soon to show you
pushed back to Symonds
pushed out into the covers
Pietersen's desperate to throw it away here. Too straight to be sweeping, and he just gets it over Gilchrist's head
Gilchrist is "loving this" from George. Bell isn't, and he can't get a single to leg
but he can this time, timing it nicely off the back foot
just short of a length, paddled through midwicket - really well placed indeed and there's the 100 partnership
cracked through the covers, like only Pietersen seems able to do - a flourishing, expansive drive but the sweeper out there cuts off four
better line from Hogg this time, just on leg-and-middle and it's blocked out
ooh that's a terrific stroke from Bell - from a poor ball from Symonds, too short, drifting down leg and Bell works it down past short fine leg. Class
shot! Too short from Symonds and again down the leg side, Bell flicks this time - over the same fine-leg region for four. Top class
once again it's turned down to fine leg but just for a single this time
Pietersen lunges forward with that huge, erm, lunge and pumps it to mid-on
a pull, crashed over midwicket. Not fully in control of it I don't think, nor timing it sufficiently
full toss which is pumped to Hayden at mid-off, who misfields
wide of the leg stump, Pietersen chumps it to midwicket
and again Bell just nudges it to leg

close! Very, very close. A quicker ball, outside off, Pietersen tries to sweep it on the full and it just passes his off stump, evades his bottom edge, evades Gilchrist and Hogg's tongue is flapping around uncontrollably
nudged to square leg for a single
ah, Bell grabs a reverse-sweep from his locker
well bowled! Full, fast, straight and defended on the front foot
clunked off the back foot but he can't time it, working it to leg for a zero
ooh driven, and driven hard, but - well, no, it wasn't timed at all. I'm speaking rubbish
ooh close! Very, very close to chopping on there. He went to drive on the up but got a thick inside edge
that was quick - and there's the first sign of reverse swing from Tait, that one just bending into the batsman who mis-defends

my word, that was severely quick from Tait, rising up onto Bell's neck - and Bell, cool as a frozen cucumber from Alaska, fends it off deliberately. We think. He did appear to have it under control - as much as any "fend" can be. At least he had the foresight to angle it down to third man
and it's punched, firmly, through midwicket
great start, right on off stump and it's defended
punched to mid-off on the up, and Hodge is quick to throw down the stumps, or at least attempt to, but the throw was wide. Pietersen is so quick between the stumps
ah, deliciously, deftly late-cut down to third man
too short, but Bell can't get a run here, just pushing it to cover
tries to drop this out into the covers but can't get enough bat on it
that is some shot! My word, punching McGrath off the back foot over cover. Fabulous shot
pulled on the up. You might think I've just made up that stroke, but in fact Pietersen plays it all the time. It's like a front footed pull, but while on the charge

dropped! Pietersen skies it over the bowler's head; Hayden jogs to his right from mid-on and, somehow, shelled it. Hogg was coming in from mid-off in the opposite direction but, really, that was a bizarre drop. Careless
ooh a slower ball which Pietersen reads and defends
wild and wooly, like a mountain sheep, down the leg side
Tait is absolutely tearing in here. That was up to 94mpg (151kph) but the direction was all wrong, down the leg side and actually Gilchrist does brilliantly to prevent four
cracked to Hayden at mid-off who receives predictable ironic jeering from the crowd
quick and nasty again. Tait is absolutely spitting nails out there and Bell defends
touch of reverse swing from McGrath, angling into Pietersen who tries to drive, and does drive, but can't time it
too short and it's hammered through midwicket. No! It smacks into Rudi, the square-leg umpire who does a rather impressive star jump but the ball thuds into his left knee. Rudi doesn't flinch
oh there we go, Bell departs - McGrath perhaps held it back a touch, Bell trying to drive it over cover but his head fell back and the ball spooned to Hussey at extra cover
a misdirected bouncer wide of Collingwood's off stump who evades it with ease
too straight, prodded to leg but straight to mid-on
well played! Attempted yorker which is dug out by Collingwood and his big spade, timing it surprisingly well to deep square leg
tucked off the legs in front of square leg
yorker out of the top drawer, Collingwood just gets bat on it and does well not to fall over in the process

lovely delivery, top class that one: Collingwood looking for the reverse swing and playing away from his body on his back foot. There's just a thin edge - but one without doubt - and Gilchrist clings on
tries the inswinging yorker, just gets his radar wrong, and that's worked to leg, Flintoff off the mark immediately
outside off and that's just defended down off the back foot
excellent ball rounds off a very tidy over, that one shooting through past the chest after nipping back in, just a smidgen, off the seam and on to Gilchrist
pops that one into space on the leg-side, the ball just catching his bat
big loop and that one's worked in front of square
turned away off his legs to square
gets over the ball and looks to drive it through long-on, but has to check the shot a touch, and drives it back to the bowler
good stuff again from Hogg, Pietersen only finding room to play that to square
right up there, a slow, tricksy yorker, and Pietersen does well to shuffle, and reshuffle, his feet to find room to defend
pushed right up there, yorker, and that's driven to mid-on
banged down outside off, perhaps a touch short, but that's just worked off the back foot easily enough to the man at cover
strays that one down leg, Tait immediately turns to look at Rudi Koertzen, expecting a wide... the umpire thinks about it, and then makes the sign
defended this time
up there on a good length, and that's defended forward
driven to mid-on this time
worked off his legs to deep square leg and Flintoff steals the strike
does well to get the bat on it and work to leg
pushes that one across the righthander, who drives into the covers
swept firmly down to Bracken behind square
attempted sweep shot, signalled as leg byes, and Pietersen plays under the ball which scoots on down to third man
huge shouts for lbw, it pitched in line, but may have just gone on to clip off - there was enough doubt, though, and Pietersen had got a big stride in
swept behind square this time
over the wicket, that's worked out to deep midwicket, where there's some tidy one-two fielding and the ball's thrown back pretty quickly
on leg, and that's shuffled into the midwicket region off the front foot
outside off, moves off the seam away from the batsman a fraction; he waits and steers that down to gully, Clarke with some excellent work to his left to cut the ball off
poked down off the back foot into the covers this time
straight drive, so straight, alas, that that crashes into the stumps at the other end
down the off-side channel and that's cut off the back foot straight to point
swept down on one knee and that's out to square
oh, excellent delivery, moving off the seam away from the righthander and that wasn't picked whatsoever

a little touch of air and the ball tempts him outside his crease. It deviates past his outside edge, turning a touch and Gilchrist completes the move with some sharp glovework and Flintoff's on his way
tickled off his hips behind square
"Catch" they cry, but that lands safe
driven out to long-off and that completes an excellent over by Hogg
on leg and that's driven to the man in on the one on the leg-side
across the righthander, with enough width for that to be driven to cover
on middle-and-leg, takes the pace off the ball, the batsman puts the pace back on with a swish to leg
more width on the off side, and that's played  to the sweeper out on the cover boundary
tried to drive it through the covers, but pressed down into the ground off the edge, a touch of luck as that rolls away to third man and he knows it, giving a little grin
defended this time
goes for the sweep, misses
turns that one back in from just outside off and Bopara's temporarily bamboozled
on off, a hint of turn again, and Bopara deals with it with a defensive
nearly a carbon copy of the Flintoff dismissal, the wrong'un, turning away from the batsman... but Bopara stayed in his crease
gets tempted to play at that one away from his body; luckily for him he missed
defended this time
and yet more defence to finish what's been another probing over
driven to long-off
on middle-and-leg and that's swept to the man at midwicket
slower ball, and there's a half shout, that one pitching on leg
on middle, turning a touch away from the righthander, who pokes it into the off side
eased out to long-off this time
on leg, and that's flamingo whipped off the front leg, just to the man, though, at midwicket
driven off the toes, without much power, to the man in the ring on leg
flaps the bat onto that one, wristing it to the man at leg
another dot as that one can only be manoeuvred to the leg
more wristy stuff, this time finding the gap through the 45
driven to long-on
Pietersen backs away, exposing all three stumps, before the ball's even delivered and, as he did the last time he backed away, he drives on the front foot to long-off
very full, very wide, Pietersen can only clump it back to him
hammered down the ground. Actually, it was more of a wooden mallet rather than a hammer - and long-on collected
crashed through extra cover, to deep extra
"great bowling, Pig" cries Gilchrist as McGrath lands this on middle and Bopara watchfully defends
and this angles into Bopara who is back and across, defending
full and straight, a touch of reverse swing into Bopara who again can only punch it back to McGrath
and it's drifting down leg, Pietersen attempts to sweep but he forgot his chimney brush
ooh lovely timing there, really hammered it on the full out to deep extra cover. But straight to the man in the sandpit
gives himself a touch of room outside leg before guiding it into cover, just using the pace of the ball
full and straight and driven back to Symonds
just a little wider and it's punched wider still of the bowler
spooned aerially, but meekly, just short of mid-on
full, just a hint of reverse but it was too wide of the off stump. Pietersen lines up a colossal drive, but can only time it to mid-off
straighter this time, allowing Pietersen to work it to leg
a big, raucous appeal from Tait; Bopara went some way across his stumps, was rapped on the pads but it was just sliding down leg
and again, that's got to be out! No, again Rudi turns it down - again a magnificently vehement appeal from the bowler but, again, it's just sliding down leg
oh blimey, a shot of typical madness from Pietersen. Short of a length from Tait and Pietersen tries to hit it into the ocean, but it skies over mid-on rather meekly
well bowled indeed, an inswinging yorker which is dug out
an it is an attempted yorker, but ends up a full bunger which is bunged back to the bowler, who parries it to mid-on allowing them to scamper a single
Bopara digs this out to Symonds at mid-on and they set off for a quick single but, for once, Symonds can't field cleanly
short, wide, cut past point for four. That's Pietersen's strength, capitalising on the bad balls - and that's his first four in 61 deliveries
crashed to long off for a single
grief, I thought he had bowled him there. The inside-edge clunky noise rather sounded like the stumps being shattered. As it was...it bobbled out to leg
full and straight and blocked out
lovely shot from Bopara, a check-drive through cover - perfectly placed. Hayden runs in the sandpit and doesn't dive, such is the danger of the outfield. Thus; four
drifting down leg and it bobbles off his pads
Pietersen lines up a rocketing drive but it bobbles pathetically back to the bowler
turned off his hip
short of a length, Bopara rocks back and, with wristy wrists, wrists it through midwicket
good running, good batting - Pietersen just dropped it to leg and scampering through for a single. He had to get his skates on, mind - but he did, and they were good skates
ooh it's powered back to the old man McGrath who bends down, without doing his back in, and gets half a hand to prevent four
that was rather close to plucking out his leg stump there, and Gilchrist missed a potential stumping chance. Rather unfairly called a wide, too
cracked on the front foot with a great deal of flourish, but he finds the sweeper on the rope
timed back to McGrath who again fields well in his follow through
too short to be driving, but he does drive and it's worked to leg
short, pulled around the corner
ooh and Bopara goes for it, pulling it off the front foot just short of midwicket
a full bunger which takes the batsman by surprise, and it's smacked without power back past him to mid-on
what a shot, but he's found Hussey at deep midwicket. It was an extraordinary flick, timing it to Hussey on the boundary who took an easy catch
lovely ball, full and straight and KP can only hit it back to Bracken
crashed back to the bowler again who gets a finger on it, parrying it onto the stumps. But Nixon, at the non-striker's end, is safe
another full toss. They just can't get him away and it's sponged to deep extra
full, if a little too full, allowing Pietersen to ping it down to long-on for a cheeky cockney single, thus retaining the strike
and there's his hundred. Another full toss bunged down the ground. Pietersen skips through for a single, and jumps in delight - pumping his fist and roaring his pleasure.
and he plays and misses
ah, good play from Nixon, shuffling around his crease like a man with ants in his jockstrap, putting McGrath off his line before working it to leg
ooh here we go! Pietersen takes a step outside leg, tries to crack McGrath over his head but can only hammer it back to him
brilliant bowling. Full and straight, Pietersen steps a mile outside his leg stump trying to whack him down the ground but can't time it
and again Nixon plays and misses
a full bunger which Pietersen can't make anything of, just clobbering it off the back foot to a wideish long-on
makes this into a full toss, and works it to long-on for a single
ooh Bracken sends it wide of Pietersen who slaps it - only just reaching it - flobbing it to mid-off
and he's gone this time, trying to lift Bracken for six but it's hit flat, and straight to Michael Clarke who needs not move a muscle, taking a very simple catch
ooh close! A play and a miss from Saj Mahmood who is very nearly bowled
another full toss, well, what a catch! That's a marvellous catch from Hodge, Mahmood slicing it to him at backward point who tumbled to his right and took a fine catch
much more like it! Nixon just flicked it, getting under the ball and smacking it over long-on. Terrific blow
and he tries to replicate the shot before, smacking a full toss but straight down Hodge's throat at long-on who swallows it with ease
and he goes for an almighty heave ho over cover, swings and misses, his bat almost knocking him on his rear in its swishing follow through
Monty takes a step outside leg but, with a good eye, claps it to long-on
full, swinging into Anderson who completely misreads the line. McGrath roars his appeal and up goes the finger

inn2.comm: over the wicket, and there's no swing on that one, neither from the ball, nor the batsman, who opts to live as it runs away down the off stick
again no swing, that one angling flat across Gilchrist, who reaches out to defend
more width outside off, although this was tighter on the sticks, Gilchrist leans into that one and drives straight to Bell who ends up sitting on the floor in his efforts to stop it
swing at last and nearly does for Gilchrist, who steps into the shot and drives at it, but it swings a touch late and nearly takes the inside edge
scoots that one down the off-side, wide enough for Hayden to leave first up

really close - huge shouts from everyone, but Bowden shakes his head early, and firmly, that one pitches in line, straightens and would have taken off-and-middle three quarters up the sticks. Perhaps the umpire thinks he hit it, or that it pitched outside leg. It looked very close
full toss and Gilchrist doesn't miss out - far from, in fact, leaning into that one and driving it off the bottom of the bat through cover; a strongly struck rocket

another huge shout, Rudi Koertzen is unmoved, and that one would have moved on to take the off stump according to HawkEye. Mahmood doesn't think so, though, nearly backing into the batsman as he moves back and back in his appeal
dinked into the ground off the back foot and on to the man at cover
Gilchrist doesn't get hold of that one, driving into the ground and straight to the man in short and straight on the off side
short, on the legs, and you really can't bowl it there to him - help yourself stuff - and that pull shot nearly took out Bowden who did a last-minute shimmy at square
another drive off the back foot, he doesn't connect, and indeed it wasn't the length he was expecting - but it's certainly a signal of his attacking intent
pushed right up there and that's driven back out, without much power, to long-on
great delivery to a righthander... unfortunately Hayden isn't, and that one slinks down leg, on a good length, but wide enough to be called so
clunk-and-run, Hayden dropping that one into the covers and they set off for a risky single, but head back
defended into the leg side
scorching shot off a half-volley, just leant on that one on the rise and it raced away through the covers
tickled off the pads in front of short midwicket and Pietersen does very well to  dive on the run, sliding to his right to pick that one up
straight and that's worked into the leg side without much fuss
pitches up and rises at the batsman who defends down off the back foot
on off and that's driven to the man at cover
on leg and Gilchrist is so quick to get onto that one - fast eyes, fast hands, and that's swished away off his pads through orthodox fine leg
straight and that's worked straight to Vaughan at midwicket who picks it up and mock-shies at Gilchrist's stumps
slower ball, wide, and that's just easily left alone
right up there, straight, and that's driven to the man straight in on the off
comes down the track, tries to hook, and misses it completely - the ball strayghing down leg
comes forward again and drives this one to mid-on this time
beautiful shot that one - short, and that's hit so cleanly over and in front of midwicket
pushed right up there and that's defended
leg-side filth
played off the back foot, with a strong defence, Hayden's head behind the bat
short and that's driven to the man in at short midwicket
defended this time
right up there outside off, that's driven to the man at cover and "Waiting!" is what Gilchrist decides to do
straight and that's defended quickly down off the back foot and will they run? "No!"
slower ball, picked, and defended
pushed up there, nearly a half-volley, and that's driven to mid-off. Nixon thinks that's "Real good, Saj"
slower ball, picked again, and eased back out on the off-side with a straight bat
on leg and that's turned away off the pads to midwicket
on leg, and that's merely eased away through fine leg
driven out to long-off
straighter, but still a touch short, and that's eased out to midwicket
moves off the seam away from the lefthander who still manages to drive it through covers. There's a bark of "No" in case there was any doubt about a run
connects strongly with that one, on the back foot, and defended into the covers
steps into that powerful, well-placed drive through cover. Four all the way
pushed right up there and that's defended down off the back foot into the covers
width, and Pietersen spares Mahmood's blushes by snapping up the ball at cover
short and that's turned away behind square, Anderson misfielding on the backward-of-square-leg boundary
on leg once more and that's whisked away off the hips behind square
slower ball, outside off, and that one finds the fielder at cover
slower ball, and that's good running from the pair, as that one's nibbled out to mid-off with a mere push
pushed right up there and some more good running, that one nudged towards mid-off
on legs and that's a piece of superb timing off the hips which races away through square
width, and Gilchrist cover-drives; he's just toying with those fielders in the off-side ring, piercing the ring and two set off in pursuit
played off the back foot to cover
play and a miss this time, Gilchrist playing away from his body, driving to cover, but the ball shoots through
good ball to end the over, straighter, tucking him up for room and he defends down off the back foot
beat short cover, and just to the left of extra-cover, who ran round and dived... Bell the fielder
big backlift and he crashes that one to point
slower ball that may as well have had a bell on it, width, and that's cut really well off the back foot and that's a typical Gilchrist full-throttle number
a touch, only a touch, of room and that's a tip-and-top tip-and-run
slower ball and Hayden just drops his bat onto that one, working it behind square
straight, and that's just dibbled into short midwicket off the back foot
ooh and immediately he induces an inside edge from Hayden's heavy-footed attempted clump through the covers
and Hayden marches down the pitch, ala Ian Bell but with great threat, but like Bell he can't make anything of it, just pushing it back to the bowler
good line and length and Hayden guides it to gully
that is savage. Unhindered violence from Hayden, marching down the pitch and fairly smiting the ball over midwicket which bounces once, maybe twice, before thudding into the boundary boards
oh and he's hammered this one too through the covers, but Bell is quick to dive to his right and prevent four
goddim! Held that one back a touch, Gilchrist was unsure whether to go forward or back; in the end, a rather nothing shot prodded a simple catch to Paul Collingwood at point
good line, but it's full enough to be driven to mid-off for a thoroughly cheeky single
on middle-and-off, good loop from Monty and it's driven back to the bowler
excellent line again - at a good, nagging pace. Not too quick. And Ponting watchfully blocks it out
again good pace - he's been too quick through the air so far in the tournament, and Ponting defends
Ponting once again forward to defend this
and just a touch tighter in line, on leg stump, and Ponting smothers the spin
smacked to cover with immense power
a full bunger which Hayden whacks into the ground, with intent, but it bobbles out to Vaughan at mid-off
and a huge swing-and-a-miss from Hayden who, had he connected with that, would've smacked it into another island
touch wider of the off stump and he shoulders arms
and here he goes. The chirping isn't working; Hayden just lofted a good length ball over long-off. Simple, calculated hitting
and he pushes forward, guiding it to gully
Ponting forgets all about the defensive prods which characterised Monty's previous over and smacks him over long-off, very nearly for six
quicker and fuller; Ponting works it to leg
drags Ponting forward who pushes it to leg
too short from Monty but actually he gets away with it, Ponting cracking it off the back foot but straight to cover and they pick up just a single
easily worked to mid-off for another single
good line outside off, on a good length too and it's guided off the face of the bat into the off side
no great pace from Flintoff there, but it's a good line and worked into the covers
Hayden comes ominously down the pitch, making it into a full bunger but Hayden can't bisect the gap in the covers
solidly forward, easing this behind square
another full toss - we've seen a dozen or so of those today - and Ponting just whips it through midwicket with a flash of the wrists

that's an excellent piece of cricket, of awareness by the two batsman. Wide of the crease from Flintoff, and Hayden uses the angle to guide it down to Monty at third man. Aware of his weak throw, they steal a single
bat-padded out into the off side
and the big, tall left hander is watchful in defence
less watchful this time, just angling this to a short third man
and again it's wide enough for Hayden to snick it down to a short third man who, to his credit, is quick to skip across - but Ponting is quicker, and sprints through for a single
Ponting skips down the pitch but is almost beaten in the flight, and is saved by bat-padding it away
nudged to the leg side, and another single is milked
swept down to short fine leg, and another piece of excellent running between the wickets grabs them another single
oh that's immensely bad luck for old Flintoff, Ponting driving on the up and very nearly chopping it on. Nixon hasn't a hope and it flies down for four
pushed without great timing to Anderson at mid-off. Ponting wants two; Hayden is more sensible and sends him back
a full toss which Hayden pumps to Anderson again
beautifully stroked but straight to the Sherminator, Ian Bell, at cover
nearly! Flintoff sent it a foot wider; Ponting saw it, and tried to crash it through cover but found nothing more substantial than thin air
on-driven but again Ponting can't place it, and it's smudged to mid-on
good line, on middle-and-off and quick enough to force Hayden's defence
just outside the off stump and, this time, a little shorter allowing Hayden to guide it down to third man
wide of the off stump, crashed to mid-off
ooh and he sweeps a flatter delivery, a straighter delivery too but no run on offer there
well, that's just effortless frankly. Not a very good ball, not turning enough and it's delightfully cracked over mid-off for four
drags Ponting forward here, nice bit of turn and he smothers it cautiously. Good comeback from Monty
full and straight  -  too full, in fact - and Hayden drives with a crack of the bat to mid-off for a single
ah, superbly cut - a late-cut off a fast bowler - but straight to point
straighter delivery this time, and Ponting bat-pads it into the covers
again it's watchfully defended by Ponting to a ball just outside his off stump. Good, nagging line this
good line again, and Ponting refuses to be tempted into driving
a huge appeal from Flintoff who is absolutely convinced he has Ponting leg before, but replays indicate the ball was just going over the top. And he was outside the line, too. Not out, then

bowled him! Or has he? Good line on off stump and just shaves the off stump. Collingwood roars an appeal - Hayden is so massive at the crease that it's quite hard to see the stumps. But Rudi confirms it with a nod of the head
good start to Clarke, just on off stump and cutting back into him a touch. Pushed out into the covers
pushed to Strauss at mid-on - oh, who fumbles pathetically. Schoolboy error there and Clarke's off the mark
ooh and that swings in a touch to Ponting
flicked to midwicket, but he can't bisect the gap
late cut for a single
outside off and that's driven to mid-on
pushed up there outside off and that was driven down off the back foot to cover
quickly single to mid-on, good scampering there, like that
on a good line and length, and that one is just fended into the covers
squeezed into the leg-side from off on the front foot and there's some good communication from the pair
pushed right up there and that's pushed again into the covers
no great pace, of course, but he places that one on a good length and Ponting can't get it away
again on an awkward length, just tucking Ponting up on line with off, and he fends down
width this time and Ponting should have cashed in. Instead, he short changes himself with a drive straight to cover
straighter, but overcompensates with the line, allowing Ponting to nibble that one down off his hips just in front of square for an easy single
good line this time, on off, but drags it a touch short and that's driven to mid-on
back to where he started this over, on a good line and awkward length and that's just defended forward
worked to short midwicket
outside off and that's worked well into the covers and there's some good quick running
on leg and there's a run-out chance if Vaughan had hit at Ponting's end; Ponting had given up on that. As you've guessed by now, Vaughan missed, not by much... but good as a mile
on leg and that's driven in front of midwicket
driven out into short midwicket
Clarke squared up there, and that's an excellent over from Anderson, the batsman only able to defend that down into the off-side off the back foot
driven out to mid-on and there's a quick single there, clever stuff
up there and that's defended on the back foot
single to Strauss at mid-on, again risky, but in fact he would have been back comfortably
Ponting pierces the leg-side with a punt off his legs
leans over that one which is slightly on leg and works it to midwicket
driven to long-on for an easy single
thinks about driving that one on the up, but in the end he has to defend
more of the good stuff, this one straight and up there, and Ponting works that to mid-on, thinking of the single, but deciding against it in the end
drives that one out to mid-off and the call is a clear "No!"
tricks that one off leg, it's a bit short too, with a lovely clip to midwicket
Clarke comes down the track before Anderson releases, short one and he misses out, trying to pull that, but it clatters straight into his thigh off the edge and they eke out a single
hit firmly through midwicket, nice shot, that
took the pace off that one and it's defended forward
great drift in the air, reversing back in to the batsman who does well to get some bat on it
driven forward and there's a misfield through cover. Panesar does well to stop it just inside the rope
bit of loop on that one and that's driven to mid-on
drifted back into the righthander and that's driven out to the cover boundary
slower delivery and that's driven to Bell at short midwicket
driven out to point
stands on tiptoes to reach into that shot and play down to cover
short and pulled from outside off in front of midwicket
straight, but Clarke's ready for that, and he works it in front of square and they run through very quickly
played behind square and Panesar does well behind square on the boundary... ah, deep backward square leg, that will be it
driven out to the cover boundary and there's an easy two
waited and waited and flicked it with his wrists down to fine leg. The ball wheezes over the line in the end, much like a marathon runner
defended down off the back foot this time
a hint of inswing there and Ponting plays that into his leg
an attempted stumping from an off-side wide. A bit harsh the wide, you'd suspect, but no doubt on the fact that Ponting's foot was firmly grounded
well swished off the hips but there's some great teamwork on the boundary, Anderson sliding to keep the ball in and Pietersen winging it back
straight, up there, and that's driven out to long-off
slower delivery, outside off, and that's driven slowly into the covers. "No!" doubt whether they're going to take a single or not
on a length outside off and that's driven straight to the fielder at cover
on a length outside off and that's driven straight to the fielder at cover
dabbed down off the back foot behind point
driven through cover
driven forward back to the bowler, who can't get a hand on it, and the mid-off does the tidying up
just leans into that one and times it off the bottom of the bat through cover
driven back to Panesar who stifles the ball like a groping puppy. Good stifling
played off the front foot to short midwicket
driven to cover
this time it's Ponting's turn to stifle, head over the ball in a good forward defence
driven out to Collingwood at mid-on, there's no run on
this one's driven to cover

thrashed - absolutely laced behind point for four. You just do not, and cannot, bowl short and wide - to anyone - but least of all Ponting. Least of all in a World Cup, in a crunch match - never mind on a pitch this flat. Terrible bowling
and there's his 60th fifty from 69 balls, as he knocks this leg-side drifter down for another four
pumped to Strauss at deep extra cover for a single. Oh no, Strauss makes a complete hash of it and they grab two
down the leg side and that'll be a wide
pushed on the front foot to mid-off. A much better length here from Mahmood, albeit on a line far, far too wide once again
again too wide, Ponting goes for it and misses
on leg stump, and worked through midwicket
a full toss which is easily worked down the ground
better length, but it's deadened into the off side and, well, they're so quick between the wickets these two
more milking, this time into the leg side
on leg stump, Ponting sweep to fine leg and they pick up two without breaking sweat
on middle and off, attacking the stumps and it's firmly defended
ooh good ball to finish the over, Ponting pushing at it rather airily. Safely but waftily
on off stump, pumped back to Flintoff who fields in his follow through
very wide of the off stump and Clarke easily guides it through cover, threading the gap with ease
have some of that, umpire, Flintoff asks. But the umpire's had more than enough of it, and it's not out - drifting down leg by some distance
ah deliciously played, late-cut down to third man
the wrong line from Flintoff. England simply must bowl straight if they're to have half a chance in this game. It drifts down leg and is worked for a single
once again on leg, once again worked to Bopara for a couple
tosses this up on leg stump; Clarke gives himself room, and a shimmy, pinging it to long-off
back onto his stumps, Ponting cuts it late but is sent back by Clarke
class and elegance all combined into one wristy flick over midwicket. That's it really. Just a flick
excellent comeback from Monty, the ball holding its line and Ponting was nearly beaten in the flight
pushed down to long-on
good length this time, but Clarke plays it late and with soft hands
full and straight, firmly punched to midwicket
just short enough to allow Ponting to work it down to Monty at fine leg
ooh well bowled there, just a touch slower and it's pushed to leg
another slower ball but Clarke waits for it and elegantly turns it to fine leg
cracked back to Collingwood who is almost wrong-footed, but flings out his right hand to field
easy, excellent batting. A touch slower and Ponting just lifts it over mid-on for another four
full and wide, smashed on the front foot - just opening the face a touch - for three
not a bad shout from Monty, rapping Ponting on the pad but it's just outside the line
pushed out into the covers
once again pushed to cover - and brilliant running hands them a single
ooh short and wide, cracked off the bat foot but straight to cover
and he flicks it through midwicket for a single. Make that two - that is quite brilliant running
too short and wide and it's driven off the back foot to mid-off
but Collingwood manages to send it down 22 yards, but it's too short and paddled around the corner
clumped to mid-on on the front foot
and it's sent wider of Clarke this time who calmly times it into the covers
magnificent shot. Too short, and a front-foot-hammering-pull sends it sailing past Bopara at deep midwicket
too short once again and turned around the corner
on leg stump and milked through midwicket
neatly nudged to midwicket
ooh and he runs down the pitch at Monty, sweetly timing it to cover
good length, good pace; cramping him for room and a cut stroke is whacked into the ground
"carved," as Gnasher of Cricinfo fame describes, over cover. Glorious shot
even better. Straighter this time, over long-off
spearing down the leg side and it's worked through miidwicket
breaking news: a defensive shot from Ricky Ponting. A rare piece of blocking from the Australian captain
guided on the front foot past cover
Clarke steps outside leg, by some distance, but Flintoff follows him - cramping him for room and he smudges it around the corner
excellent, direct, full, fast and straight delivery which is blocked out
good bouncer, evaded relatively easily by Ponting - but, like the previous straight delivery, England just haven't been straight enough
good start from Collingwood on middle, but Clarke's well set and strokes it through midwicket
ooh nice slower ball, if a little "loopy" and predictable, Ponting just smooching it to mid-on
just wider of the crease, kissing the turf, and it's caressed into cover
and he flirts with the idea of hitting over the top before stroking it to leg
full and straight, smooched through midwicket
pushed down to long-on

oh, an appeal there, hit the pad first, but then that gets forgotten as there's a run-out - the ball was dabbed down and Collingwood shied down the stumps from close range. Ponting was so out he was walking
Flintoff leaps into the air in appeal, but that one, although full and low and rapping Symonds, was sneaking down leg
caressed off the hips, literally, behind square
driven into the covers and that's well picked up by Pietersen
...and Flintoff acts as the seventh, scooping that one up on the bounce off his own bowling
worked to Vaughan at short midwicket who shapes to return it, with aggressive intent
pushed right up there and that's driven into the covers
Symonds goes big; a slower ball, too short and that's launched off the back foot over the non-existent cow at cow corner

really good effort from Pietersen that - he caught it just inside the midwicket boundary and then he keeps tiptoeing and tiptoeing inside the rope, before flicking it into space inside as he goes over. There's much discussion and referral and many many replays. But not out, in the end, he mustn't have been in control, in their opinion
slower ball and there's no doubt this time - Symonds powers that over mid-off and that's gone all the way for six, nice
drives that one to cover
pushed right up there and driven out to long-on
outside off and that one's driven to cover
width on that one, and smoked to the cover boundary, into the ground and past the outstretched finger of Collingwood at point
driven straight to short midwicket
pushed right up there and driven to long-off
played and missed as that one came back in off the seam. Nixon spots the chance to run out Symonds who he thinks is out of his crease. He's not
play and a miss again, that one nearly cutting him in two - not literally, of course
top bopping from Bopara in the covers, diving round to his left to cut that one off
on leg and that was driven off the legs into midwicket
pushed right up there and dug out off the front foot to the covers
smashed over the top, plenty of bottom hand, and that's beaten Panesar at long-off
on leg and that's turned square
gets some bat on that one, turned straight round to Nixon
outside off and that's played into the covers with a shuffling of the feet
up there, on off, and the batsman brings his bat and leg together in defending that one into the covers
slight touch more width outside off and that's eased out off the back foot to the point boundary
a bit too full from the bowler and it's timed very well to long-off to bring up his fifty from 59 balls; this is his 24th at this level
bangs that one in short and that's pulled to Panesar behind square
outside off and that's cut away off the back foot through cover
right up there, and that's taken off the legs into short midwicket
slower ball again, Symonds dances down and that's lashed over cover for a resounding four
slower ball, ill-directed, this one heading down leg and Symonds works that one down through fine leg, off his pads
on middle-and-leg and that's played out to midwicket
driven back to the bowler
bouncer, Symonds just ducks under it, nonchalantly as you like
on leg and Panesar wings that back as fast as he can from the boundary, but the batsmen are quick enough to get the two, and in the end it's a comfortable two indeed
wide outside off and that's a good shot by Clarke, leaning into it and driving it through cover
right up there and that's driven back to mid-on
pushed up there and that's driven back to the bowler
straight ball, up there, and that's driven back into the ground, Anderson picking it up on the first bounce
a half-volley outside off, Symonds launches into it, a lashing cover drive, but mistimes it a touch and it rolls through the covers
great ball, a lifter surprising Symonds as it whistles past his chest, Symonds having to arc back like a snake to avoid it
short ball and that's lashed through midwicket with a firmly struck pull to end the match
